recipe.name: Baked Italian Chicken with Potatoes
recipe.description: Turn every day ingredients into something special! The chicken does not need to be marinated because this recipe makes a wonderful sauce, but if you do then it will be even more tasty. I like to par boil the potatoes because I really love how it sucks up the flavour of the Italian Dressing. But you can skip this step if you prefer to cook it all in the oven - refer to Note 4 for steps.
recipeIngredient: 4 - 5  chicken thigh fillets (, skin on and bone in (about 6oz/200g each))
3 (around 1.5lb/ 750g in total)  medium size potatoes (, peeled and cut into bite size pieces)
1/2 cup mozzarella cheese (, grated (or any other good melting cheese))
1/2 tbsp each dried rosemary and thyme ((OR oregano) leaves (or 2 tbsp fresh))
3 tbsp red wine or white wine vinegar ((Note 1))

recipeInstructions.text: Boil or microwave the potatoes until slightly undercooked - about 5 minutes boiling / 5 minutes on high in a steamer in the microwave. Use a fork to rough the potatoes up a bit - this allows the potatoes to absorb more of the dressing flavour - and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil or microwave the potatoes until slightly undercooked - about 5 minutes boiling / 5 minutes on high in a steamer in the microwave. Use a fork to rough the potatoes up a bit - this allows the potatoes to absorb more of the dressing flavour - and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat 1/2 tbsp olive oil in large oven proof skillet over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, season the chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat 1/2 tbsp olive oil in large oven proof skillet over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken and brown well on both sides - around 5 minutes each side.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken and brown well on both sides - around 5 minutes each side.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove skillet from heat, and pour off the excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove skillet from heat, and pour off the excess fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes around the chicken and pour over the crushed tomatoes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper and drizzle the Italian Dressing all over.
recipeInstructions.name: Place potatoes around the chicken and pour over the crushed tomatoes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper and drizzle the Italian Dressing all over.

recipeInstructions.text: Place cherry tomatoes on top and bake for 25 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Place cherry tomatoes on top and bake for 25 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and sprinkle on cheese, then bake for a further 5 minutes until the cheese is melted and golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and sprinkle on cheese, then bake for a further 5 minutes until the cheese is melted and golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with basil leaves if you wish.
recipeInstructions.name: Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with basil leaves if you wish.

review.reviewBody: So lovely and fresh tasting - I overcrowded the skillet, but the flavour went thru everything. Great and easy
I cooked this delicious recipe tonight and the family loved it. Thank you so much. Looking forward to trying more of your recipes.
A lovely creation.   Such eye appeal     Dang Girl I could eat the PHOTO
I added 3 Tbsp of red wine to the dressing, next time tried it with white wine yummy both ways.  Would make this for company & easy!
I made this last night for a dinner party. It was beautiful! I added some deli bought mixed marinated olives from woolies and it really was lovely!
